translated: Is emptiness included in the aggregate of volitional formations?
Is the signless included in the aggregate of volitional formations?

analyzed: suñña tā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: Is emptiness included in the aggregate of volitional formations?
Is the desireless included in the aggregate of volitional formations?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  animittam na

translated: Is the signless not to be spoken of as included in the aggregate of volitional formations?
Is emptiness not to be spoken of as included in the aggregate of volitional formations?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  appaṇihitaḥ na vattabbaḥ

translated: Is the desireless not to be spoken of as included in the aggregate of volitional formations?
Is emptiness not to be spoken of as included in the aggregate of volitional formations?

analyzed: suñña tā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: Is emptiness included in the aggregate of volitional formations?

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho na anicco na saṅkhato na paṭiccasamuppanno na khayadhammo na vayadhammo na virāgadhammo na nirodhadhammo na vipariṇāmadhammoti?
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho na aniccaḥ na saṅkhataḥ na paṭiccasamuppannaḥ na khaya dhammo na vaya dhammo na virāga dhammo na nirodha dhammo na vipariṇāma dhammo ti
translated: “The formations aggregate is not impermanent, not conditioned, not dependently arisen, not subject to destruction, not subject to vanishing, not subject to fading away, not subject to cessation, not subject to change?”

original: nanu saṅkhārakkhandho anicco saṅkhato paṭiccasamuppanno khayadhammo vayadhammo virāgadhammo nirodhadhammo vipariṇāmadhammoti?
analyzed: nanu saṅkhāra kkhandho aniccaḥ saṅkhataḥ paṭicca samuppanno khaya dhammo vaya dhammo virāga dhammo nirodha dhammo vipariṇāma dhammo ti
translated: “But, friend, is the formations aggregate impermanent, conditioned, dependently arisen, subject to destruction, subject to vanishing, subject to fading away, subject to cessation, subject to change?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci saṅkhārakkhandho anicco …pe…🔽vipariṇāmadhammo, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci saṅkhāra kkhandhaḥ aniccaḥ pe  vipariṇāma dhammaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
suñña tā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: “Then it is not right to say: ‘The emptiness of the formations aggregate is included in the formations aggregate.’“

analyzed: rūpakkhandhassa suñña tā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: “Is the emptiness of the form aggregate included in the formations aggregate?”

analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandhassa suñña tā rūpa kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: “Is the emptiness of the formations aggregate included in the form aggregate?”
“Is the emptiness of the feeling aggregate …

analyzed: viññāṇa kkhandhassa suñña tā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: of the consciousness aggregate included in the formations aggregate?”

analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandhassa suñña tā viññāṇa kkhandha pariyāpannā ti
translated: Is the emptiness of the formations aggregate included within the consciousness aggregate?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Saṅkhārakkhandhassa suññatā na vattabbā—
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  saṅkhāra kkhandhassa suñña tā na vattabbā

translated: “Is the emptiness of the formations aggregate not to be spoken of as included within the form aggregate?”

analyzed: āmantā  rūpakkhandhassa suñña tā na vattabbā
saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  saṅkhāra kkhandhassa suñña tā na vattabbā
translated: “Is the emptiness of the form aggregate not to be spoken of as included within the formations aggregate?”🔽“No,” he said.
“Is the emptiness of the formations aggregate not to be spoken of as included within the feeling aggregate …

analyzed: āmantā  viññāṇa kkhandhassa suñña tā na vattabbā
saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is the emptiness of the consciousness aggregate not to be spoken of as included within the formations aggregate?”

analyzed: suñña tā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: “Is it not to be said that emptiness is included within the formations aggregate?”
“But has it not been said by the Blessed One:🔽‘Monks, these volitions are empty of self or of what belongs to self’?

original: “suññamidaṁ, bhikkhave, saṅkhārā attena vā attaniyena vā”ti.
analyzed: suññam idam bhikkhave saṅkhārāḥ attena vā attaniyena vā ati
tena hi suñña tā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati
translated: “In that case, emptiness is included in the aggregate of volitional formations.”
The Discussion of Emptiness is finished.
